;;Mycoplasma pneumonia is not limited to children, adults should also be careful. Recently, a 30-year-old Ms. Zhu from Guangzhou developed fever, chills, weakness in her limbs, and coughed up yellow sputum. She originally thought it was a common cold, but she didn't get better. After a bronchoscopy, it was discovered that it was "mycoplasma pneumonia." After targeted anti-infection He was discharged after improvement after treatment. ;

;

;;She has an inexplicable high fever that persists and cannot be relieved by ordinary treatments;

;

;30-year-old Ms. Zhu is usually in good health, but she suddenly developed a fever recently. The maximum body temperature was 39.8°C, accompanied by chills, chills, and weakness in the limbs. She went to the hospital for treatment. After the doctor gave her ibuprofen to reduce fever and cephalosporins to fight infections, her symptoms were not significantly relieved. She then coughed up yellow and white sticky sputum that was difficult to cough up, especially at night.

;

;So, Ms. Zhu came to the outpatient department of the Department of Respiratory and Critical Care Medicine of the Second Provincial Hospital to seek treatment. Dr. He Yaowei discovered through chest CT examination that she had an infectious lesion in the lower lobe of her right lung, so she was admitted to the hospital to further improve the examination.

;

;The doctor found through bronchoscopy that there was a large amount of yellow-white sticky sputum in Ms. Zhu's right lower lung bronchus. Through rapid etiology testing, "Mycoplasma pneumoniae" was discovered. In other words, Ms. Zhu suffered from the recently popular "Mycoplasma pneumoniae pneumonia".

;

;In view of her situation, the doctor gave her levofloxacin for targeted anti-infection and symptomatic support treatment such as cough and phlegm reduction. Ms. Zhu quickly improved and was discharged. ; ;

;

;;

;

;Chest CT before treatment: Multiple small flakes and patchy increased density can be seen in the lower lobe of the right lung , the density is uneven, the boundary is blurred, patchy consolidation shadows can be seen, and air bronchial shadows can be seen within them.

;

;;;

;Thorax CT after treatment: Multiple small flakes and patches of increased density in the lower lobe of the original right lung were significantly less dense than before. light.

;

;;Mycoplasma pneumoniae is also an important causative agent of adult pneumonia;

;

;Sun Ruilin, director and chief physician of the Department of Respiratory and Critical Care Medicine of the Second Provincial Hospital, explained that mycoplasma pneumonia is Acute pulmonary infection mainly caused by interstitial lesions caused by Mycoplasma pneumoniae is significantly different from pneumonia caused by common bacteria such as Streptococcus pneumoniae in clinical manifestations. Therefore, it is clinically distinguished from Legionella pneumophila, Chlamydia pneumoniae and acute pneumonia. Pneumonia caused by other atypical pathogens such as grammaticis is collectively referred to as "primary atypical pneumonia".

;

;The current epidemiological survey results of multiple adult community-acquired pneumonia (CAP) in China show that Mycoplasma pneumoniae and Streptococcus pneumoniae are important pathogens of adult CAP in my country.

;

;According to reports, the incubation period of mycoplasma pneumonia is 1 to 3 weeks, and the onset is diverse. Most patients only have low fever and fatigue, and some patients may have sudden high fever accompanied by obvious headache and myalgia. and nausea and other systemic symptoms of poisoning. The most prominent respiratory symptoms are dry cough, which often lasts for more than 4 weeks, is often accompanied by obvious sore throat, occasionally chest pain, and blood in sputum. In a few severe cases, respiratory failure may occur, manifesting as respiratory distress.

;

;Among the non-respiratory symptoms, earache, measles-like or scarlet fever-like rash are more common, and a few patients may be accompanied by gastroenteritis, pericarditis, myocarditis, meningoencephalitis, myelitis, and hemolysis. anemia, disseminated intravascular coagulation, arthritis and hepatitis, etc.

;

;Having few positive signs in the lungs and obvious imaging manifestations are important features of mycoplasma pneumonia. The lesions are mostly cloud-like patchy infiltrates with blurred edges and low density, radiating from the hilum to the peripheral lung fields. When the lung parenchyma is involved, large consolidation shadows may also appear.

;

;Quinols and tetracyclines are the drugs of choice for adults with mycoplasma pneumonia

;

;According to reports, commonly used drugs for the treatment of mycoplasma pneumonia include macrolides, fluoroquinolones and Tetracyclines and macrolide antibiotics (such as azithromycin and clarithromycin) are currently the drugs of choice for the treatment of mycoplasma pneumonia in children. Quinolones and tetracyclines are the drugs of choice for adults with mycoplasma pneumonia. However, there are also mycoplasma pneumoniae and macrolide antibiotics. Lactone antibiotics are resistant, so the clinical selection should be based on the individual situation of the patient.

;

;Will mycoplasma pneumonia cause "white lung"? A small number of mycoplasma pneumonias invade a wide range of lesions or have poor mucus drainage, involving the bronchi, alveoli, and interstitium of the lungs, causing "atelectasis" and even "white lungs" on imaging. Through effective anti-infection, expectoration, and shooting, Back and bronchoscopy treatment and other methods can cure the disease in a short time, and most patients have a good prognosis.

;

;Doctors remind that Mycoplasma pneumoniae infection can occur throughout the year, especially in late summer, autumn and winter, when the incidence is high. The main sources of infection are patients and carriers, which are mainly spread through air droplets, such as coughing and sneezing. Preschool and school-age children and adolescents over 5 years old are at high risk.

;

;The preventive measures for mycoplasma pneumonia mainly include: ① Stay away from the source of infection, regularly open windows indoors for ventilation, and it is recommended to wear a mask when going to crowded and closed places. ② Perform good hand hygiene, wash hands frequently with soap (hand sanitizer) and running water, or use alcohol-based hand sanitizer to wipe your hands. ③Eat more fresh vegetables and fruits, drink enough water, get enough sleep, and exercise moderately to enhance immunity.

;

;Sun Ruilin, director and chief physician of the Department of Respiratory and Critical Care Medicine of the Second Provincial Hospital, reminded that during the period of high incidence of respiratory infectious diseases, if you have upper respiratory tract infection symptoms such as cough and fever, it is recommended to seek medical treatment as soon as possible to find out the cause. Treat in a targeted manner and do not take medicine on your own to delay the condition.

;On November 15, 2023, the United Kingdom will send 150 soldiers to Japan to participate in the "Alert Island 23" military exercise . This bilateral exercise is the first joint exercise since the "Reciprocal Access Agreement" between the two countries officially came into effect.

;

;A week ago, the fifth "2+2" meeting between Japan and the UK's foreign ministers and defense ministers was held face-to-face again after a lapse of five years. In a joint statement issued after the talks, the two sides made it clear that they would increase the frequency of joint exercises. In addition, Japan will also provide cooperation with the United Kingdom in dispatching an aircraft carrier strike group to the Indo-Pacific in 2025.

;

;Providing cooperation for the deployment of British aircraft carriers to the Indo-Pacific is just the latest step in deepening defense cooperation between Japan and countries outside the Asia-Pacific region. At present, Japan is promoting the joint development of next-generation fighter aircraft with the United Kingdom and Italy.

;

;Japan not only extended military cooperation invitations to European countries, but also played diplomatic cards in Southeast Asia. Previously, from November 3 to 5, Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida visited the Philippines and Malaysia for the first time. Since the beginning of this year, the Kishida government has frequently visited Southeast Asia, covering almost 10 ASEAN member states.

;

;"Japan's efforts to win over countries in and outside the Asia-Pacific region such as the United Kingdom, France, Australia, and the Philippines are nothing more than wanting to revisit its old dream of the Russo-Japanese War and seek more interests for itself. While the United States continues to promote its Indo-Pacific strategy ', and in the context of great power competition, relevant countries have also followed suit, trying to get a share of the regional game." Teng Jianqun, director of the Diplomatic Research Center of Hunan Normal University, told Southern Weekend reporters that in the context of multipolarization of international politics and global economicization, At the moment, Japan is trying to win over a large number of countries to stir up trouble in the Asia-Pacific.

;

;On November 9, the spokesperson of the Chinese Embassy in the UK responded to the erroneous remarks about China in the UK-Japan “2+2” joint statement, saying, “China has indisputable territorial sovereignty and maritime rights in the East China Sea and South China Sea. rights and interests. China will unswervingly safeguard its sovereignty and rights and interests, and firmly oppose relevant countries to sow relations between regional countries and create confrontation and confrontation. If the UK and Japan really want to become responsible countries, they should stop fanning the flames and stirring up trouble everywhere. Do things that contribute to regional peace and stability."

;

;;

;

;On January 11, 2023, local time, London, England, British Prime Minister Sunak (right) and Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida in London Towers sign defense agreement. ;(Visual China/Picture);

;

;Winning over

;

;On November 7, Fumio Kishida met with the US Secretary of State at his official residence Lincoln talks, exchanged views on the Palestinian-Israeli conflict, and confirmed that the two sides will cooperate on related issues. The day before, Blinken had just concluded his "whirlwind diplomacy" in the Middle East and arrived in Japan to attend the Group of Seven (G7) foreign ministers' meeting.

;

;The G7 Foreign Ministers’ Meeting, held in Tokyo from November 7th to 8th, was the last offline meeting hosted by Japan during its tenure as the G7 Presidency. During the meeting, Japanese Foreign Minister Yoko Kamikawa held talks with the foreign ministers of Canada, Germany and other member states, and took the opportunity to hold 95-minute consultations with the British Foreign Minister and Defense Minister.

;

;In talks with defense ministers from various countries, the concept of a "free and open Indo-Pacific" was frequently mentioned by Japan.

;

;"Japan's reaffirmation of the 'Indo-Pacific Concept' through the G7 Foreign Ministers' Meeting is just a rehash of old tunes with nothing new. What really deserves attention is Japan's gradual advancement in implementation." China Institute of International Studies Tang Qifang, associate researcher at the International Institute for Strategic Studies, analyzed this to a Southern Weekend reporter.

;

;In December 2022, the Japanese government adopted three security documents: the revised "National Security Strategy", "National Defense Strategy" and "Defense Force Preparation Plan", which not only clearly stated that it must have counterattack capabilities, but also emphasized that While taking the Japan-U.S. alliance as the foundation, we will deepen cooperation with so-called "friendly countries that share values" and strive to realize the concept of a "free and open Indo-Pacific."

;

;Less than a month after the "Three Security Documents" were released, Japan and the United Kingdom signed a "Reciprocal Access Agreement", allowing both sides to conduct larger-scale and more complex military exercises on each other's territory. At this point, the United Kingdom has become the only European country that can conduct bilateral military exercises on Japanese territory, and is also the second country to sign this agreement with Japan after Australia.

;

;"After the promulgation of the new security strategy, Japan's defense policy has shifted from defensive to offensive, and the weapons and equipment, combat posture, and troop deployment of the Japanese Self-Defense Force have also changed from defensive to offensive." Teng Jianqun pointed out, "The signing of the Reciprocal Access Agreement means that the relationship between Japan and relevant countries is entering a paramilitary alliance. The Japanese Self-Defense Forces can use this to go out and send troops to the United Kingdom and Australia to achieve the so-called 'national normalcy' in a roundabout way." At the same time, Japan also wants to take the opportunity to release its military production capacity and accelerate the entry of weapons and equipment into the international market."

;

;In addition to linking up with countries outside the Asia-Pacific region, the Philippines has also become a key target for Japan to try to win over.

;

;On November 3, Fumio Kishida arrived in the Philippines and held talks with Philippine President Marcos. In Manila, Fumio Kishida delivered his first speech to the Philippine Congress. In his speech, Kishida Fumio praised that bilateral relations between Japan and the Philippines have entered a "golden age." At the same time, Japan and the Philippines also reached a consensus on launching negotiations on the Reciprocal Access Agreement.

;

;"The targets chosen by Japan are all core members of the US military alliance. Australia is known as the US's 'Southern Anchor' in the Asia-Pacific region, and the UK is its core ally in Europe." Tang Qifang pointed out, "Although the Philippines is weak, the new President Marcos has tilted his foreign policy toward the United States after taking office. The United States is trying to turn it into a sharp thorn wedged in the South China Sea."

;

;Linkage

;

;Japan is not only "casting a wide net" on the road to expanding its "paramilitary alliance", but also continues to promote joint military exercises with relevant countries.

;

;Japanese media reported that the goal of the "2+2" talks between Britain and Japan is to enhance military coordination and interoperability by holding "more frequent and more complex military exercises." After the signing of the Reciprocal Access Agreement, the first joint military exercise between Japan and Britain is on the way.

;

;In addition, during the meeting of the G7 foreign ministers, the United States dispatched two aircraft carriers, the USS Ronald Reagan and USS Vinson, and the Japanese helicopter carrier USS Hyuga to conduct joint military exercises in the Philippine Sea. Rear Adm. Carlos Sadillo, commander of the U.S. Navy's First Aircraft Carrier Strike Group, pointed out that the exercise was designed to "demonstrate how the United States and Japan can quickly respond to crises and interoperate and coordinate."

;

;In Australia, the Japan Air Self-Defense Force is seeking to normalize military deployment. Japan plans to station F-35, F-15 and F-2 fighter jets at air bases in Australia as early as fiscal 2024, with each deployment lasting several months. Japanese media pointed out that there is no clear legal basis for dispatching permanent troops to Australia or providing security assistance when necessary.

;

;"The Reciprocal Access Agreement facilitates joint military operations between Japan and Britain and Australia, and the same equipment purchased from the United States provides a sufficient platform for mutual integration and interoperability." Military Expert Wang Qunhuai told Southern Weekend reporters.

;

;In July 2020, the United States approved the sale of 105 F-35 fighter jets to Japan. Adding the 42 previously purchased, Japan will have a total of 147 F-35 fighter jets. Australia and the United Kingdom are also "die-hard fans" of F-35 fighters and have ordered a total of 210 F-35 fighters from the United States.

;

;At the same time, in 2023, the United States successively agreed to sell hundreds of "Tomahawk" cruise missiles to Australia and Japan to enhance its naval long-range strike capabilities. It is worth mentioning that the United States has always been very cautious about the export of "Tomahawk" missiles. Prior to this, Britain was the only country besides the United States to possess this type of missile.

;

;"In fact, the sale of weapons and equipment is an important tool for the United States to strengthen alliance relationships. The more American equipment is used, the deeper the relevant countries will be tied to the United States, and the more military sovereignty concessions will inevitably be made." Analysis by Wang Qunhuai.

;

;Japan’s military assistance to the Philippines came more directly. "The Kishida government not only wants to provide money and equipment, but also tries to send troops to the Philippines." Tang Qifang said.

;

;During his visit to Manila, Fumio Kishida sent a "maritime gift package" to the Philippines. According to a senior Japanese government official on November 3, Japan will provide five sets of fixed coast surveillance radars to the Philippines. This is the first time Japan has provided defense equipment to a foreign country under this mechanism since it established the "Government Security Capability Strengthening Support" (OSA) framework in April.

;

;"In the past, Japan focused on relying on 'government development assistance' (ODA) and using economic diplomacy to expand its international influence, but now it has turned to improving the security capabilities of recipient countries." Tang Qifang pointed out, "Japan It is hollowing out the peaceful constitution step by step, trying to transform from an economic power to a military and political power."

;

;Team formation

;

;The interviewed experts and scholars told Southern Weekend reporters that Japan and the United Kingdom , the Philippines and other countries inside and outside the Asia-Pacific region "form a circle" and actively carry out defense cooperation, each getting what they need and utilizing each other.

;

;In 2016, then Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe held talks with Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi and proposed the "Free and Open Indo-Pacific Strategy" for the first time in the joint communiqué. "Since then, Japan has continued to promote this proposition in diplomatic settings, intending to cooperate with the United States in enhancing its intervention capabilities in the East China Sea, South China Sea and even the Asia-Pacific region, and to demonstrate its presence and enhance its international status and influence." Tang Qifang pointed out .

;

;In Tang Qifang’s view, Japan’s continuous breach of red lines in defense policy is inseparable from the acquiescence and connivance of the United States. "The United States expects Japan to act as a 'pawn' in the Asia-Pacific and help it reduce its burden and pressure. Japan also hopes to vigorously develop its military power and pursue becoming a military and political power. Although the interests of the two sides are different, the strategic goals are basically the same."

;

;The United Kingdom, Australia and other countries also have their own plans.

;

;"After Brexit, the UK has become an 'outcast' in Europe. Based on geopolitical considerations, the UK hopes to use Japan as a 'bridgehead' to strengthen its military deployment in the Asia-Pacific and highlight its status and From the perspective of business interests, the UK attaches great importance to the economic vitality of the Asia-Pacific region." Teng Jianqun analyzed that this is also the main reason why European and Asia-Pacific countries are willing to cooperate with Japan.

;

;As early as March 2021, the British government released "Global Britain in the Era of Competition: A Comprehensive Assessment of Security, Defense, Development and Foreign Policy", which pointed out for the first time that the UK's global strategy must move towards the "Indo-Pacific" "region" tilt, and in May of that year dispatched the most advanced "Queen Elizabeth" aircraft carrier strike group to the Indo-Pacific region for the first time to conduct so-called "freedom of navigation" operations.

;

;However, the British aircraft carrier's "global journey" did not go smoothly. Two destroyers accidentally separated from the formation. In September 2023, the British Navy's "Queen Elizabeth" aircraft carrier conducted joint patrols with allies along the coast of Norway and the North Atlantic. Due to the significant reduction in the number of British Air Force fighter jets, the British aircraft carrier, which can normally carry about 30 F-35B fighter jets, only carries 8 fighter jets.

;

;"The wish of 'Global Britain' is very good, but Britain is no longer the 'Empire on which the sun never sets' in the past. Whether its strength can match its ambitions is still a question. And the Philippines is not only weak in strength. On the other hand, the determination to follow the United States is not as strong as that of Japan, Britain and Australia." Tang Qifang pointed out, "It remains to be seen how important the relevant countries can play in the so-called 'Indo-Pacific strategy'."

;

;Facts As a die-hard ally of the United States, Japan is not willing to become a "tool" of the United States and still hopes to regain its autonomy.

;

;In December 2022, the United Kingdom, Japan and Italy announced that they would jointly develop a common airframe for next-generation fighter aircraft. The three countries are determined to integrate their respective capabilities in cutting-edge air combat technologies such as stealth and high-tech sensors. By 2035 The latest fighter jet was launched years ago. It is worth noting that this is the first time since World War II that Japan has participated in a joint research and development program for advanced fighter aircraft that does not include the United States.

;

;At the same time, Japan has specially set aside funds in its defense budget for fiscal year 2024 and plans to develop an air-to-air missile for use by the next-generation fighter aircraft jointly developed by the three countries.

;

;"Japan does not want to put all its eggs in the American basket, nor does it want to hand over its military industry dividends to the United States. However, historically speaking, no matter what kind of cooperation Japan adopts, it will It is difficult to break through the restrictions imposed by the United States in military production. This time is no exception. The United States will try its best to block it and strangle its research and development plans, including Japan's new generation fighter aircraft, in the cradle." Teng Jianqun concluded, "Japan's Strategic independence has always been difficult to escape from the constraints of the Japan-US alliance framework."

;Lin Li runs an independent coffee shop on Beijing Road in Guangzhou. This shop has been open for more than three years and is currently experiencing difficulties. During this period, the monthly turnover could not cover employee wages.

;

;Lin Li told reporters from Nandu·Wancaishe that this year there has been a wave of store openings in the coffee industry. Some people who do not know how to open stores blindly open stores and occupy market space. Professional community coffee shops have attracted customers who know how to taste fine coffee. , and the spatial experience originally provided by independent coffee shops has become no longer rare, because chain coffee shops are also setting up large stores.

;

;“The chain coffee brands with larger store areas have taken away the in-store customers, and the community coffee shops along the street have taken away the in-store and take-out coffee cups. In short, now coffee shops The density is too high." Lin Li lamented.

;

;;

;

;Since this year, Coffee chains are making every effort to open stores. Recently, Cudi Coffee, which was founded just one year ago, announced that it has more than 6,000 stores, setting a new record for domestic coffee stores; Luckin announced that it has more than 13,000 stores and predicts that it will open 15,000 stores by the end of this year; Starbucks is also speeding up Expanding stores, it "opens a new store every 9 hours in China"; Manner, a specialty coffee brand founded in Shanghai, is also running wild. Yesterday (October 30), its number of stores officially exceeded 1,000.

;

;At the same time, amidst the craze for coffee, a large number of coffee shops failed to survive this year. Statistics from the third-party platform Kamen show that in the first nine months of 2023, the number of newly registered coffee-related companies was approximately 45,000, an increase of 74.10% over the same period last year, and 9,825 coffee companies were deregistered, with the number of cancellations increasing by 58.95% year-on-year. .

;

;Recently, reporters from Nandu Bay Financial News visited a number of independent cafes, trying to understand whether they can survive the "9.9 yuan cup of coffee" storm and the increasing density of coffee shops. , what do they rely on to survive?

;

;Cafes are everywhere, and the 9.9 yuan price war continues

;

;Nearly 10,000 coffee companies closed down in the first nine months

;

;Lin Li works as a manager at an independent coffee shop on Beijing Road in Guangzhou Store manager, this store has three floors. The first floor of the store serves as the entrance. The second and third floors are bright and comfortable with simple decoration. There are large floor-to-ceiling windows on the side near the corner, allowing you to have a panoramic view of the outside scenery.

;

;The coffee products sold in the store include classic American coffee, milk coffee, special coffee and hand-brewed specialty coffee, with prices ranging from 20 to 100 yuan. There are also some baked simple meals for single consumption. The amount is about 50 yuan.

;

;;

;

;Lin Li told Nandu ·Wancaishe reporter, "There used to be many customers on weekdays, and the daily turnover could reach tens of thousands of yuan." It is located in a tourist area, and it is "extremely busy" on weekends.

;

;However, since the adjustment of epidemic prevention and control measures this year, the operation of the store has turned from profit to loss. In this regard, Lin Li said that he originally thought that there would be more customers this year, and he also vigorously promoted some creative and special products at the beginning of the year to attract traffic, but the effect was not good. "Currently, the turnover is only two to three thousand yuan on weekdays and tens of thousands of yuan on weekends." However, after deducting the high cost of 65,000 yuan in shop rent, water, electricity and raw materials, there is still more than 10,000 yuan left, which is not even enough to pay employees' wages.

;

;Although it is located in a popular tourist destination, tourists do not help its business much. During the National Day this year, boss Lin Li visited nearby coffee shops. Although the streets were crowded, there were many empty seats in the coffee shops.

;

;Lin Li told reporters an observation: Foreign tourists are basically adults with children, and they do not have the habit of drinking coffee. On the contrary, Guangzhou locals did not travel abroad last year and came to coffee shops to kill time. There are more people.

;

;In addition to changes in consumer customer groups, the increasing number of coffee shops on the streets has also impacted store business. Lin Li bluntly said that there has been a wave of store openings in the coffee industry this year. Some people who do not know how to open stores blindly opened stores, squeezing the market space. “The chain coffee brands with larger store areas have taken away the customers who come to the store, and the community coffee shops along the street have taken away the customers. The number of coffee cups sold in stores and for takeaways has increased. In short, the density of coffee shops is too high now."

;

;The density of coffee shops in the Beijing Road business district is indeed increasing. Nanduwan Financial News reporter learned through Dianping that there are about 200 coffee shops within 2 kilometers of the Beijing Road business district. As of October 27, about 30 coffee shops have opened in the past three months, that is, every Within three days, a coffee shop opened in the Beijing Road business district. Among them, there are many well-known chain large space coffee shops such as Lavasa Coffee, store by.jpg, M Stand, and Starbucks.

;

;Since this year, chain coffee brands have indeed been making great efforts to open stores. For example, Kudi’s stores have exceeded 6,000, and Luckin’s stores have exceeded 13,000. Statistics from Kamen show that in the first nine months of 2023, the number of newly registered coffee companies was approximately 45,000, an increase of 74.10% compared with the same period last year. At the same time, many coffee shops have fallen in the coffee wave. Kamen data shows that in the first nine months of 2023, 9,825 coffee companies have been canceled, and the number of cancellations has increased by 58.95% year-on-year.

;

;In addition to intensive store openings, leading coffee chain brand Luckin Kudi Tims has also successively launched promotions of 9.9 yuan/cup or 8.8 yuan/cup, lowering the selling price of coffee in order to seize the market share. customer. Although there is a big difference between the customer base of low-price coffee and the customer base of independent coffee shops, the impression that a cup of coffee only costs 9.9 yuan is still engraved in the hearts of many consumers.

;

;;

;

;Lin Li revealed, A customer once was surprised when he saw the price list after entering the store, "Americano coffee actually costs more than 20 yuan." However, Lin Li believes that "six or seven years ago, the Americano and latte we drank were more than 20 yuan a cup." Yes, this is the normal price."

;

;Bill, another independent cafe operator, also encountered customers who were confused about the price at his store. Bill thought, "American and American cuisine cost more than 20 yuan. The nine-yuan American style uses different coffee beans, and the taste is different, so the price is naturally different."

;

;However, due to the competitive pressure brought by the store opening wave and price wars, Bill's store coffee Some price adjustments have been made. For example, the price of iced Americano coffee has been reduced to 20 yuan, and many stores have launched a beverage promotion of "42% off in the morning and 32% off in the afternoon on weekdays".

;

;Reduce the store area and shift towards high-end customers

;

; Sun, 19 Nov 2023 16:25:03 +0800 商务部清理歧视外资措施，废除“特斯拉禁入”是个好的开始丨快评http://www.infzm.com/contents/260899
;;2023-11-19 15:00:00;
;

;商务部发言人日前在例行新闻发布会上表示，近期商务部组织专项清理，进一步排查可能存在的歧视外资企业的规定和措施，为外资企业营造更加公平的市场竞争环境。

;

;据商务部网站，11月8日商务部外资司发文，要求对含有内外资不合理差别待遇内容的规定及措施进行专项清理。清理范围包括各地政府、部门出台的法规、规章、规范性文件、其他政策性措施，以及相关部门制定的与经营主体相关的各类措施。文件还列举了多项具体的清理事项，包括在准入领域针对外资的限制，以外资品牌为由歧视或者排斥外资企业及其产品和服务，排斥或者限制外资企业参加政府采购等等。

;

;商务部开展这一专项清理行动，是有的放矢的。近年来，随着中国经济实力提升，以及外部“脱钩断链”等贸易摩擦，国内出现了一股“已经足够强大，不再需要外资”的论调。社交媒体上也出现了越来越多敌视外资品牌产品的言论，甚至一些地方出现了限制外资品牌产品的现象。前段时间，湖南岳阳三荷机场以“涉密管制”为由，禁止特斯拉电动汽车进入机场。在引起极大关注后，岳阳机场取消了这一限制，但类似现象在很多地方部门仍然存在。除了特斯拉，受到特别“关照”的还有苹果公司的手机等电子产品。

;

;这种针对外资品牌的限制并没有法律依据。 2023年9月，外交部发言人毛宁曾在记者会上表示，中国没有出台禁止购买和使用苹果等外国品牌手机的法律法规和政策文件。有些部门和企业禁止特斯拉汽车、苹果手机等的理由，是其摄像头、麦克风等传感器可能获取周围环境信息上传到国外，涉及“国家机密”“个人信息安全”等。但是，根据特斯拉的声明，其汽车的“哨兵模式”所拍摄的视频只存储在车辆本地的存储设备中，并不会联网上传。其他的车辆数据，也只会上传到公司在中国境内设立的数据中心。苹果公司国内用户所使用的iCloud服务，也由国内的大数据公司“云上贵州”负责运营。

;

;特斯拉、苹果虽然是外国品牌，但其在国内销售的产品基本上都是在中国境内的工厂生产的，其在上海的超级工厂就有1万多名员工。此外，特斯拉汽车零部件的国产化率已超过95%，更拉动了上游产业链诸多国内企业的发展，不仅为这些企业的员工带来了收入，也提高了企业的生产水平。这些企业生产能力的提升，也为国内其他汽车厂家的发展提供了能量。苹果公司也是如此，不仅其在国内的代工厂直接为数十万人提供了工作岗位，而且通过对国内供应商的严格管理，大大提升了国内产业链的能力。

;

;引进外资，引进的绝不仅仅是那些几亿甚至几十亿金额的金钱，更重要的是企业家精神和才干，是发现甚至“创造”市场机会，并抓住机会、创造社会财富的能力。改革开放过程中，引进外资对中国经济发展起到了巨大的推动作用。这种推动作用，并不仅仅来自金钱本身。中国引进外资的目标，也不只是解决国内发展资金不足的问题，更重要的是“学习西方先进的技术与管理经验”。

;

;事实上，对推动中国发展起到更大作用的，可能正是随着外资而来的竞争、管理等理念。正是外资倒逼下，中国市场化改革得以加速，国内企业也在与外资竞争中强身健体，发展了起来。即使现在中国已经成为全球第二大经济体，但仍然需要引进外资。因为在很多领域，中国仍然需要国外的技术和企业家才干。

;

;2023年8月，国务院发布“吸引外资24条”政策措施，强调要营造“市场化、法治化、国际化一流营商环境”。而市场化、法治化的营商环境，就要求对外资企业一视同仁，实行国民待遇，只要不在国家规定的负面清单范围内，就不能对外资进行任何的歧视、限制。对国内的外资企业所提供的产品、服务，也应该与其他国内企业的产品和服务一视同仁。就像虽然“政府采购法”规定一般情况下政府采购“应当采购本国货物、工程和服务”，但财政部2021年专门发文，要求除了涉及国家安全和国家秘密的采购项目外，政府采购不得区别对待内外资企业在中国境内生产的产品。只要是在中国境内生产的，无论其供应商是内资还是外资，都应保障其平等参与政府采购。本次商务部的专项清理行动，也把限制外资企业参加本地招投标、政府采购的问题列入清理事项。

;

;商务部清理行动开始之后，社交媒体的信息显示，一些地方机构“禁止特斯拉入内”的标牌已经被拆除。禁止歧视外资企业，这是一个好的开始。

; Sun, 19 Nov 2023 15:25:05 +0800 人为什么变胖，问题可能没那么简单http://www.infzm.com/contents/260883

;

;The global obesity and overweight problems have become increasingly apparent in recent decades. According to data from the World Health Organization, in 2016 Nearly 40% of adults worldwide are overweight, of which 13% are obese. There are approximately 2 billion overweight people. This increase continues despite public health measures to prevent and slow obesity in many countries. Along with the obesity epidemic comes a large disease burden. How to better manage weight has become an urgent problem in the field of health sciences.

;

;;Balancing the quality and quantity of carbohydrates;

;

;Carbohydrates, as a major source of dietary energy for people, have long been the focus of weight loss. Coping strategies such as the "ketogenic diet" of eating less or no staple food, or even strictly limiting carbohydrate intake have been derived. The "ketogenic diet" cuts off carbohydrates as an energy source and attempts to promote weight loss by burning fat to provide energy. Although this method has some short-term experimental support, what will happen if it is persisted in the long term is still a mystery.

;

;Moreover, the "ketogenic diet" requires maintaining a high level of fat intake while maximizing carbohydrate intake, which may increase the risk related to cardiovascular disease. In addition, it will also put pressure on the liver, kidneys and maintenance of nutritional balance, and there is a risk of a series of adverse reactions such as cognitive decline, constipation, fatigue, and nausea. Therefore, long-term adherence to such a diet for weight loss remains controversial.

;

;However, compared with the controversial "ketogenic diet" that strictly limits carbohydrate intake, a diet that reasonably controls carbohydrates has actually been widely recognized, including paying more attention to nutritional balance and simplicity. Processed “Mediterranean Diet” etc. Recently, scientists from Harvard School of Public Health and other institutions also found through long-term observational studies that instead of focusing generally on the total amount of carbohydrate intake, it is better to pay more attention to the quality and source of carbohydrates, so as to achieve better long-term weight management.

;

;Because their research data shows that some carbohydrate-containing foods do make you fatter as you eat them, but there are also some carbohydrate-rich foods that may actually have a weight loss effect if you eat too much of them. Overall, higher glycemic index and glycemic load will lead to weight gain. Adding 100 grams of starch or added sugar per day increased weight gain by 1.5 kilograms and 0.9 kilograms respectively over four years. Relevant research was published in the British Medical Journal (BMJ) in September 2023. The main sources of daily starch are seeds and tubers such as wheat and rice, which are various staple foods.

;

;Starchy vegetables such as potatoes and peas, and refined grains are also associated with weight gain. A 100-gram daily intake increase will increase weight gain by 2.6 kilograms and 0.8 kilograms respectively. But if it is non-starchy vegetables and whole grains, the increase in intake will actually reduce weight gain and help control weight. Increasing the intake of non-starchy vegetables by 100 grams per day will reduce weight gain by 3 kilograms, and the intake of 100 grams of whole grains will reduce weight gain by 0.4 kilograms. Similarly, consuming carbohydrates through fruits can also help reduce weight gain, with a daily intake increase of 100 grams corresponding to 1.6 kilograms less weight gain.

;

;The reason why these data are limited to four years to assess weight change is because some health data in the study are updated on a four-year cycle. Using data from more than 130,000 people in projects such as the Nurses' Health Study, researchers analyzed the relationship between people's diet and weight changes over more than two decades and discovered these overall patterns of carbohydrates. Over the past two decades, people's average weight has increased by 8.8 kilograms, about 1.5 kilograms every four years.

;

;;Highly processed carbohydrates have become a target;

;

;If a person pays more attention to the management of carbohydrate quality and sources, use equal amounts of non-starchy vegetables, fruits and Substituting whole grains for foods like refined grains, starchy vegetables, and sugary drinks will result in less weight gain. In addition to foods such as vegetables and whole grains that are consumed in large amounts, an increase in dietary fiber intake also helps with weight management. Every 10 grams of increase per day corresponds to a reduction of 0.8 kilograms of weight gain. Considering that the age of the people in the study happens to span the middle-aged and elderly stages, including the critical period of weight gain in middle age, this large-sample long-term follow-up study has important reference significance for middle-aged people to strengthen weight management.

;

;Of course, although the latest research data has the advantages of large volume and long follow-up time, and can capture more changes in diet and health, there are still some limitations, such as carbohydrate intake and Information such as weight is reported by the respondents themselves. There may be certain errors in these data, which will affect relevant conclusions and interpretations. To better understand the long-term health effects of carbohydrates, more randomized, controlled, long-term studies are needed to further confirm the conclusions in the latest findings.

;

;As for why people become obese, the most popular explanation is energy imbalance, which is commonly known as "eating more and moving less", but this is not the exact answer to the common obesity phenomenon in humans. As obesity rates remain high, some scientists think the problem may not be that simple. Two common explanations currently take into account more complex body system factors. For example, one view is that on the basis that energy intake exceeds consumption, because modern people eat too much ultra-processed food with high energy density, there may also be endocrine, metabolic and nervous system effects, making it more difficult for people to eat food. Self-control.

;

;Another explanation related to insulin is that the hormonal response triggered by a large amount of ultra-processed carbohydrates causes the body to store more energy in fat, resulting in a lack of energy required for basic metabolism of the body. , after the brain recognizes this state, it will issue a hunger command, thus entering a vicious cycle of getting fatter and overeating. While the understanding of obesity remains controversial, these analyzes and a host of health studies have focused on carbohydrates in processed foods, including all types of so-called "junk food" that are high in sugar and fat.

;

;Ultra-processed carbohydrates are classified as "junk food", which is not unrelated to the current scientific community's understanding of the functions of carbohydrates. Carbohydrates are the only macronutrient for which there is no minimum intake requirement. In reality, in some places people eat a lot, but in other places people eat very little. What specific ranges of carbohydrate intake humans need to maintain in order to survive, be healthy, and even live longer are specific questions that need to be answered by scientific evidence.

;

;;The risks and costs of eating out;

;

;From an evolutionary perspective, larger brain capacity is consistent with the evolutionary process of humans, and larger brain capacity is consistent with the evolutionary process of humans. The brain needs more energy support. After humans entered agricultural civilization, typical lifestyle changes included growing and eating grains, which are foods rich in carbohydrates. For this reason, the human digestive system has become more adapted to starch, but accordingly, new eating habits have also brought about a series of new health problems.

;

;Latest research suggests that the mechanisms by which carbohydrates, glycemic index, and glycemic load may have negative health effects on weight may include enhanced responses to changes in insulin and other hormones that favor fat accumulation. . In recent years, some studies have shown that in addition to weight gain, the quality of carbohydrates may also increase a series of other health risks.

;

;In 2019, a systematic analysis study published in The Lancet showed that compared with those who ate the least dietary fiber, people who ate the most dietary fiber had better health outcomes. The risks of a range of diseases are 15% to 30% lower, including lower cardiovascular disease mortality, coronary heart disease incidence, stroke incidence and mortality, and lower risks of type 2 diabetes and colorectal cancer. In addition, clinical trial data also shows that eating more dietary fiber will lower blood pressure and total cholesterol. The lowest risk dietary fiber intake is 25 to 29 grams per day.

;

;Similarly, studies have found that whole grain intake may also help reduce overall disease risk. Increasing the intake of dietary fiber in the daily diet, replacing refined grains with whole grains, and eating more coarse grains will not only help with weight management, but also improve people's health.

;

;It is worth noting that with the epidemic of obesity in recent years, scientists have tried to verify a variety of weight loss and weight management strategies, most of which are related to "eating", including the total energy of meals and the amount of food consumed. time. In 2022, a one-year intermittent fasting trial carried out in China found that while restricting food energy, arranging eating times from 8 am to 4 pm every day and not eating at other times, such a The weight loss effect of this dietary pattern is no better than that of energy restriction alone, indicating the importance of controlling energy intake for weight loss.

;

;However, in April 2023, Australian researchers further narrowed the eating time window to 8 am to 12 noon every day, limiting the intake of 30% of the required energy to only these four hours. And you stick to this eating method for three non-consecutive days in a week, and you can eat whatever you want at other times. The experimental results found that under certain circumstances, intermittent fasting that limits meal times still has its own unique effect, not only can Lowering the weight of trial participants could also improve people's glucose tolerance and reduce their risk of type 2 diabetes.

;

;Leonie Heilbronn, a professor at the University of Adelaide School of Medicine and others who have long studied fasting and meal times, explained to Southern Weekend reporters that human metabolism is governed by biological rhythms The brain operates downwards, alternating between day and night 24 hours a day. Improper eating time will cause the brain's light and dark rhythms to be out of sync with the biological clocks in other organs and tissues. Moving meals earlier and avoiding eating at night will help the body coordinate these rhythms. combine.

;

;In 2022, a randomized controlled trial in the UK also supported the conclusion of eating early, but it was not because of differences in metabolism at different times, but because the study at that time found that if you eat more in the morning, your overall health will be reduced throughout the day. If the meal time is moved forward, people will not feel too hungry that day, and appetite and total energy intake will be controlled.

;

;;Weight management should be a long-term plan;

;

;For weight control, no matter what the strategy is or how difficult it is, whether it can be persisted in the long term is the key to weight management. key. Otherwise, no matter how radical and rapid the weight loss method is, it will rebound when you can't persist, and destroy people's confidence in weight management during the continuous rebound. Some people whose obesity problem is particularly serious and whose weight loss through conventional methods has been ineffective can only reduce their health risks through extremely limited methods such as bariatric surgery. However, this method requires the removal of part of the stomach, which is extremely invasive and does not work. Not suitable for most people who have less severe weight problems.

;

;From this perspective, the latest research controls weight by managing the source of carbohydrates, which does not involve harsh food intake restrictions or long fasting times, and has positive implications for people's long-term weight management. significance.

;

;Moreover, the researchers also found that the relationship between carbohydrate sources and weight management was more obvious in overweight or obese people than in people of normal weight, indicating that these people may be more susceptible to weight changes. Sensitive, more fragile, but in turn suggests that those who pay more attention to the sources of carbohydrates in their diet may benefit more from this type of weight management.

;

;Reflected in specific foods, it is necessary to limit sugary drinks and various types of steamed, fried, and baked refined rice noodles, and instead eat more roughly processed grains, fruits, and non-starchy foods. Vegetables etc. The "Mediterranean diet" widely praised by scientists is actually more scientific in managing carbohydrate sources and maintaining nutritional balance. In addition to consuming more vegetables, fruits, and whole grains, it also eats more beans and nuts, and more Fish and moderate amounts of poultry and dairy, but not a lot of red meat.

;Recently, a screenshot of a research report comparing BYD’s U8 and T-90 main battle tanks was exposed. This screenshot of the research report comes from the special research report on BYD released by the Western Securities R&D Center on October 24, 2023: "BYD (002594.SZ) first coverage report: Cost is the shield, technology is the spear, and the sword points at the global automotive leader" .

;

;On page 26 of the research report, in order to present the output power of BYD's Yi Sifang four-wheel motor, Western Securities compared the output power, engine, and body of BYD's U8 and T-90 main battle tanks. , amphibious, on-site U-turn, lateral travel, zero-hundred acceleration and the number of driving wheels, and concluded: "The technical indicators of Yi Sifang's four-wheel motor are comprehensively leading the industry." Looking up at the amphibious and lateral travel functions of U8, T -90 tanks are "none".

;

;According to Blue Whale Finance, a relevant person from Western Securities responded that the report was not written by an intern, and that the comparison of BYD’s U8 with main battle tanks was affected by relevant publicity.

;

;What is the impact of relevant publicity? Previously, many self-media compared BYD’s U8 with tanks. Regardless of whether the research report of Western Securities was influenced by self-media, but comparing electric vehicles with main battle tanks, and then claiming that its technical indicators are comprehensively leading the industry, whether the relevant arguments and conclusions are rigorous and reasonable will naturally be questioned by investors and public opinion. .

;

;In addition, in June this year, Western Securities and analysts were punished for research reports. According to the warning letter from the Shaanxi Supervision Bureau of the China Securities Regulatory Commission: After investigation, the internal control mechanism for the securities research report publishing business of Western Securities is not sound, individual surveys did not fulfill the pre-approval procedures, sales staff participated in the assessment of research report analysts, and compliance management did not cover expert consulting services. The main business links; the quality control and review of research reports are not strict, and some research reports have unreasonable valuation forecasts and imprudent conclusions.

;

;The relevant securities research report produced by Luo Yamein, the signed analyst of BYD’s research report, has problems such as imprudent research methods, lack of reasonable justification for some assumptions, and insufficient basis for some conclusions. Not only was it shown The warning letter is also recorded in the securities and futures market integrity files.

;

;Less than half a year later, Western Securities and the same analyst released another controversial research report.

;

;Of course, this was not done by a securities firm called Western Securities. In recent years, there have been numerous cases of securities companies being fined for "weird research reports". On December 30, 2021, the Jiangxi Securities Regulatory Bureau issued two law enforcement documents, punishing Guosheng Securities and its researchers for their conduct related to the research report "A Preliminary Study on the Application of Heavenly Stems and Earthly Branches in Timing". On October 18 of that year, a report titled "A Preliminary Study on the Application of Heavenly Stems and Earthly Branches in Timing" by Guosheng Securities attracted public attention. In the report, it is explained in detail how the "Heavenly Stems and Earthly Branches" dominate the market's time cycle, and how to apply the "Heavenly Stems and Earthly Branches" in timing. Liu Fubing, who issued this research report, has been in the industry for more than 12 years and has been listed as the best analyst of New Fortune 8 times, including No. 1 6 times.

;

;If we say that the above-mentioned research report is "even if it is not shocking, it will never stop", so it has become a talking point for people. There is also a type of "weird research reports" that are more likely to mislead investors.

;

;In July 2020, the Jiangsu Securities Regulatory Bureau posted an administrative penalty decision against two analysts Ma Haobo who signed the research report "Fucheng In-depth Report 2: Three 10 billion to support doubling of market value" , Tang Weiliang were fined a total of 200,000 yuan.

;

;In 2016, a research report released by Soochow Securities boldly predicted that Fucheng Shares (600965.SH), "the number one A-share funeral stock", would be the absolute leader in the funeral industry in the future. And gave Fucheng shares a "buy" rating.

;

;However, on October 25 of that year, Fucheng Shares issued a "clarification announcement" to clarify the relevant contents of the research report. Soochow Securities' "Fucheng Research Report" stated that the number of tombs after the completion of the third phase of Fucheng's pagoda cemetery will reach 400,000. Based on this data, it was concluded that Fucheng's net profit would be 15.5 billion yuan. After investigation, Fucheng Co., Ltd.'s pagoda cemetery plans to build about 125,000 tombs. "Fucheng Research Report" also stated that the industrial merger and acquisition fund jointly established by Fucheng Co., Ltd. and an investment company has a total scale of 10 billion yuan. The current scale is 1 billion yuan, and the follow-up fund scale will be 9 billion yuan. After investigation, as of October 2016, the size of the above-mentioned M&A fund was only 1 billion yuan. The status of subsequent funds will need to be made by Fucheng Shares based on the progress of the first-phase fund and the quality of the assets acquired. Third, "Fucheng Research Report" stated that the company's major shareholders have 10 billion in cash and have sufficient funds to serve as the backend of the above-mentioned merger and acquisition funds. After investigation, as of October 2016, the major shareholders had not made a decision in this regard.

;

;The relevant quoted data in the research report released by Soochow Securities is far from the actual data of Fucheng Shares. I am afraid that the source of the information and whether the data has been investigated and verified are all a mess. How can a research report like this deserve market credibility?

;

;The so-called research reports are analysis reports prepared by financial institutions such as securities companies, fund companies, banks, etc. They mainly include company analysis reports, industry analysis reports, investment strategy reports, etc. The purpose of the research report is to help investors better understand the market, the company, and the industry so that they can be used as a reference when investing. However, the content is full of errors and omissions, pointing the research direction towards Feng Shui, or making gimmicks of comparing electric vehicles with main battle tanks, which reflects that some brokers do not pay attention to the professionalism of the research report, and even use the research report as a tool for speculation.

;

;The motivation behind securities firms’ “weird research reports” cannot simply be attributed to sensationalism. In financial markets, information release is a form of power to some extent. Therefore, regulatory authorities have corresponding standards for financial institutions, listed companies, and media to release various types of investment-oriented information. As professional information providers, brokerage research reports influence investors' decisions to a considerable extent. However, in the process of pursuing so-called market influence, some securities companies make some shocking remarks to attract attention and attention. There will be traffic or profit considerations, and they may even interfere or distort market trends. Since brokerages are also one of the important stock holders in the stock market, if a brokerage publishes a research report that is "bullish" or "short" on a listed company or a certain sector in an exaggerated way, and secretly buys or sells the corresponding stocks, wouldn't it be typical? Manipulation of the stock market?

;

;In this regard, regulatory authorities have also promulgated relevant new management policies many times in recent years. In May last year, the regulatory authorities sent the "Notice on the "Double Random" On-site Inspection of the Securities Research Report Business to all securities firms. The report shows that in 2022, a special "double random" on-site inspection of research and reporting business will be carried out in the entire industry, covering a total of 45 securities companies and 300 research reports. In September of that year, the China Securities Association reiterated the self-regulatory management of the securities research business of securities firms, including that holdings of more than 1% of the research target stocks must be disclosed and that reverse operations are not allowed within two trading days of the release of the research report; however, various management measures do not seem to hinder The continuation of "Weird Research Reports".

;

;This shows that for strange research reports, the regulatory authorities’ punishment and supervision need to be strengthened. Warning letters, inclusion in integrity files, etc. cannot touch the core interests of relevant personnel and securities companies, so that they would rather have short-term market effects than adhere to compliance. Only by clarifying the responsibilities of securities firms in the production and release of research reports and continuing to increase penalties for violations can the regulatory authorities stop the vicious cycle of "bad coins eliminating good coins" in securities firms' research reports.
